project.teaser: Addressing critical challenges such as population displacement due to conflicts, exacerbated by factors like climate change, extreme weather events, food shortages, and poverty, remains paramount. The implementation of THEIA, integrating data fusion, processing, and analysis...
project.objective: Addressing critical challenges such as population displacement due to conflicts, exacerbated by factors like climate change, extreme weather events, food shortages, and poverty, remains paramount. The implementation of THEIA, integrating data fusion, processing, and analysis, particularly leveraging Geospatial Artificial Intelligence (GeoAI) and Machine Learning, is poised to enhance the efficacy of existing services significantly. Through the amalgamation of multi-temporal data and diverse datasets, THEIA empowers better decision-making and adapts to evolving policy and user needs. This technological advancement, bolstered by GeoAI, augments detection capabilities and ensures timely access to crucial information, bridging the gap between capabilities and stringent security demands. By integrating non-space data and end-user intelligence, THEIA’s supply chains add value not only at the operational level but also at regional and local levels, facilitating improved coordination. Furthermore, THEIA catalyzes fostering EU-independent capabilities and technologies, thereby bolstering the European space ecosystem's consolidation and ensuring the sustainable coexistence of legacy and New-Space solutions. Its services cater to a wide array of end-users, including EU entities such as SatCen and Frontex, Member State Ministries of Defence, Intelligence Agencies, Police Forces, NATO, and potentially Extra-EU National and Supranational Entities such as the United Nations.
project.title: Enhancing Copernicus Security Services - EU governmental crisis management hub for forced population displacement
project.keywords: Copernicus Security Services (CSS), Forced population displacement, Very-High-Resolution (VHR), Radio Frequency (RF), Machine Learning (ML), Platform

result.title: Risk Identification Management & Quality Assurance Plan
result.description: Description of the relevant procedures, quality rules and indicators set, templates, internal deadlines disclosure of QA procedures. Feedback regarding the discussion of vulnerabilities and related solutions by providing a thorough analysis of potential vulnerabilities associated with the project. This will include a detailed assessment of risks and corresponding mitigation strategies to ensure robustness and resilience in our solutions.

result.title: Stakeholders engagement plan, CSS Gap Analysis Report and User Feedback Summary
result.description: Comprehensive assessment of existing CSS services, highlighting areas for improvement, gaps in service capabilities, and recommendations for enhancement. Matrix outlining specific gaps identified in each CSS service. Also, a summary of feedback from CSS users, including satisfaction levels, challenges faced, and suggestions for improvement. Plans for engaging and consulting stakeholders and identifying challenges at the pilot sites.During the THEIA project a comprehensive overview of our stakeholder engagement strategy, including methods of communication, feedback mechanisms, and how stakeholder input will be integrated. This will ensure clarity on how stakeholder relationships are managed and how their contributions influence the project’s outcomes. The overall strategy concerning the stakeholder’s engagement will be documented in D5.1 “Stakeholders engagement plan, CSS Gap Analysis Report and User Feedback Summary” in M4. **IMPORTANT NOTE: Based on the SEC ESR deliverable D5.1, is a sensitive deliverable that the Security Advisory Board must review and give particular attention to determine whether the use cases treated in the project lead to a border security threat or vulnerability assessment.

result.title: Dissemination and Communication Plan (Version 1/1st-period)
result.description: Outlines all actions planning regarding communication and dissemination activities.

result.title: Initial Data Management Plan (DMP)
result.description: Output of T1.3. The first version of the DMP, with inputs from the 1st-period.

result.title: Use Case Definition Report
result.description: Identification and definition of new application scenarios and use cases for CSS services, aligned with emerging security challenges and user requirements. Develop a strategy for engaging with stakeholders and end-users to gather feedback on proposed service expansions and ensure alignment with user requirements.

result.title: Website and Project Logo
result.description: Development of the THEIA website and project logo, as well as of the THEIA social media accounts (Twitter/X, LinkedIn, Youtube etc.)

result.title: THEIA Ethics version 1 (1st period)
result.description: Initial version of Ethics and GDPR guidelines.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
